meanings.definition: A small piece or amount of something that has been scraped off a surface.
meanings.sent1: She found some scrapings of paint on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a handful of vegetable scrapings to the soup.
meanings.sent3: The cat left tiny scrapings of fur on the couch.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like scrapings of old paint, revealing glimpses of the past.
meanings.sent5: The detective carefully collected the scrapings for evidence.

meanings.definition: The act of scraping something off a surface.
meanings.sent1: Her scrapings of the gum from the desk were successful.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise was caused by the constant scrapings of the chair against the floor.
meanings.sent3: The scrapings of the old wallpaper were oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The scrapings of the shovel echoed in the empty room.
meanings.sent5: He winced at the sound of the metal scrapings against the wall.

meanings.definition: The act of collecting or gathering something by scraping.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist carefully examined the scrapings from the ancient pottery.
meanings.sent2: The scrapings of the wood revealed hidden markings underneath.
meanings.sent3: She giggled at the silly scrapings of the crayon on the paper.
meanings.sent4: The scrapings of the knife on the cutting board were rhythmic.
meanings.sent5: The artist used the scrapings of charcoal to create shadows in the drawing.
